title: Erdős Problem #646

overview.problemStatement: Let p1,…,pk" role="presentation" style="position: relative;">p1,…,pkp1,…,pkp_1,\ldots,p_k be distinct primes. Are there infinitely many n" role="presentation" style="position: relative;">nnn such that n!" role="presentation" style="position: relative;">n!n!n! is divisible by an even power of each of the pi" role="presentation" style="position: relative;">pipip_i? The answer is yes, proved by Berend [Be97], who further proved that the sequence of such n" role="presentation" style="position: relative;">nnn has bounded gaps (where the bound depends on the initial set of primes).
